title: AI Ethics and Governance
subtitle: Responsible AI Development
description: Learn the ethical considerations, governance frameworks, and responsible practices for developing and deploying AI systems in society.

overview.description: Navigate the complex landscape of AI ethics and governance. This course provides essential knowledge for developing responsible AI systems that benefit society while minimizing harm and ensuring fairness.
whatYoullLearn: Understand fundamental principles of AI ethics
Design inclusive and accessible AI systems
Develop AI governance strategies for organizations
prerequisites: Basic understanding of AI and machine learning
Interest in social and ethical issues

chapters.title: Introduction to AI Ethics
chapters.description: Explore the fundamental concepts of AI ethics and understand why ethical considerations are crucial in AI development.

chapters.title: Algorithmic Bias and Fairness
lessons: Sources of Bias in Data and Models
chapters.description: Learn how bias enters AI systems and discover techniques to identify, measure, and mitigate unfair outcomes.

chapters.title: Privacy and Data Protection
chapters.description: Understand privacy challenges in AI and learn techniques to protect individual privacy while maintaining utility.

chapters.title: Transparency and Explainability
chapters.description: Explore methods to make AI systems more transparent and understandable to users and stakeholders.

chapters.title: Legal and Regulatory Landscape
chapters.description: Navigate the evolving legal landscape surrounding AI development and deployment.

chapters.title: Human-AI Interaction
chapters.description: Learn how to design AI systems that enhance rather than replace human capabilities and decision-making.

chapters.title: AI Governance and Risk Management
chapters.description: Develop comprehensive governance strategies for responsible AI development and deployment in organizations.

chapters.title: Future of Responsible AI
chapters.description: Look ahead to future challenges and opportunities in the field of AI ethics and responsible innovation.

instructor_info.name: Prof. Maria Rodriguez
instructor_info.title: Director of AI Ethics Institute, MIT
instructor_info.bio: Prof. Rodriguez is a renowned expert in AI ethics and policy with over 12 years of experience bridging technology and social responsibility. She advises governments and organizations on responsible AI development.
credentials: PhD in Philosophy and Computer Science from Harvard
Former policy advisor for UNESCO on AI ethics
Author of 'Responsible AI: A Practical Guide'
Member of multiple AI ethics advisory boards

requirements: Pass all quizzes with 70% or higher
Complete the final ethics assessment project
